intro: Schwendenera tetrapyxis, commonly known as the four-angled poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by the showy bracts. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Schwendenera tetrapyxis is often cultivated for its ornamental value during the holiday season.
